intro: Dunbaria merrillii, commonly known as the Hawaiian dunbaria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae, characterized by its striking tubular flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky crevices and forest understories. Its conservation status is critically endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Dunbaria merrillii plays a unique role in the ecological balance of its native habitat and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
